wikipedia_page.main: William Whiting was an English footballer who played as a half-back for Southampton in the 1900s, before becoming a referee.

response: *William Whiting (poet) (1825–1878), English writer and hymnist, wrote the words to Eternal Father, Strong to Save (The Navy Hymn)
*William Whiting II (politician) (1841–1911), U.S. Representative from Massachusetts
*William Whiting, footballer, was born in Southampton
